node.display_long_description:
Must-have bow & arrow action game with state of the art Quest graphics. 

NEW GAME MODE “SIEGE OF HEAVEN” AND QUEST 2 UPGRADES!!!

Battle through the floating castles of medieval fantasy to restore Harmony in Heaven, Purgatory & Hell. Rain down arrows against forsaken souls and angelic creatures that have taken over the afterlife.

Finally a great Roguelite on Quest, excellent great replay value that adapts to the player’s skill level and progress as they play. Three beautiful and mysterious, procedurally generated worlds, with infinite replayability, three epic boss fights, multiple optional areas with great loot.

NEW! Free DLC with gate-defense game mode “Siege of Heaven” with 3 extra maps, 50+ new achievements, and leaderboards - perfect for new players and casual VR enthusiasts and advanced players alike, enjoy VR’s highest-rated bow & arrow mechanics shooting a safe spot in a beautiful environment.

Uses VR to the max and makes the most of Quest & Quest 2.

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
Big update is coming on February 16th!

We'll be adding SEASONS - a way to immortalize the top legends, balance the game, and reward shooting mastery with experience, ranks, and weapon skins!
On February 16th:
    - Top "OVERALL" leaderboard players will get immortalized in the Hall of Fame
    - All players will earn experience and ranks for their placement on the leaderboard
    - SEASON 2 will begin with NEW LEADERBOARDS
    - Player progress % will be retained between seasons
    - Ranks from previous seasons will be rewarded with weapon skins
Now is the best time for you to finish your runs and pump up your high scores to ensure your experience, rewards, and fame!

node.reviewDescription:
In the VR game space, the point and shoot game is an oversaturated genre. I've bought and played, in ascending order of preference; Gun Club, Drop Dead, Space Pirate, Robo Recall, Pistol Whip and In Death. Whether the targets are soldiers, aliens, robots, monsters, the mechanics remain the same. Waves of enemies, shoot them before they shoot/reach you. Out of ammo? Reload, keep shooting!

When you finally fall, there's one thing to do, try again. Can you beat your score? Maybe you've unlocked some new weapons, some attachments, but the next game will, in many cases, play out the same as the first, the same targets, popping up in the same places. How compelling you find this over time will depend on how appealing you find the theme, and if the game has a USP...

In Death is a stand out in this landscape for a number of reasons. With each run the fundamentals remain the same, you're gonna be firing arrows at Monks, Knights, Ghouls and a variety of enemies which I won't spoil here. 

However, immediately with each run the game will offer a new layout to the environment, and the game's locomotion mechanics will allow you to move through that environment with a freedom rarely offered by the genre. You can move through the environs using the analogue stick, using your magic teleportation arrows, sidestep by tossing a teleport crystal, or you can move yourself physically to avoid incoming attacks. Your teleportation power will offer up options that are not immediately intuitive, and if you experiment you'll experience moments of surprise and joy.

Each inevitable death will return you to the start of the game and you're presented with you score and progress toward a number of unlocks which are going to make your next run simultaeneously easier and more challenging. 

The Bow feels good. New types of arrow, and new enemies keep strategies changing and keep things fresh. My only criticism is that the full extent of the bowstring can lead to tracking issues.

website_page_meta.description:
Must-have bow & arrow action game with state of the art Quest graphics. 

NEW GAME MODE “SIEGE OF HEAVEN” AND QUEST 2 UPGRADES!!!

Grab your bow and rain down arrows against forsaken souls and angelic creatures that have taken over the afterlife, battle through the beautiful medieval fantasy levels of Heaven, Purgatory & Hell to restore Harmony

Three beautiful and mysterious, procedurally generated worlds, with infinite replayability, three epic boss fights, multiple optional areas.
website_page_meta.title: In Death: Unchained · Oculus Quest
